title: What is magnétisme animal and how did Adolphe Didier use it for healing?
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author talks about his transition from irrational ideas towards magnetism to a more rational approach. He wanted to seek knowledge from experienced masters and was about to attend highly instructive sessions of a magneto-therapeutic society led by Baron du Potet in Paris. However, he had to leave for England and continued his search for knowledge there. He met Adolphe Didier, brother of the famous Alexis, who had an extraordinary sensitivity to the magnetic atmosphere around objects. Didier had developed a unique method of diagnosis based on his sensitivity and was known for his ability to recognize magnetized books without touching them. In this last part (200 tokens), the author narrates the peculiar talents of Didier and his method of auscultation, opening new doors of learning for the author.
content: Dès mon arrivée à Londres je me mis en quête d’un magnétiseur, et on me fit connaître Adolphe Didier, le frère du fameux Alexis, célèbre sous le second empire pour sa lucidité somnambulique. Adolphe semblait tenir de famille une organisation sensitive d’une extrême délicatesse. Il parvenait à percevoir au toucher l’atmosphère magnétique dont les objets sont entourés. Didier se prêtait, en effet, à l’expérience suivante : En l’absence du sensitif, on choisissait sur les rayons d’une bibliothèque un livre, que l’on tenait un instant avec l’intention de le magnétiser. Ayant ensuite replacé le volume et introduit Didier, on voyait celui-ci fermer les yeux et promener lentement la main devant les livres, sans les toucher. Le volume magnétisé était ainsi reconnu sans hésitation. Didier avait basé sur sa sensibilité une méthode spéciale d’auscultation. en promenant sa main devant les différents organes d’un malade il percevait les anomalies du rayonnement vital, et arrivait ainsi à une diagnose, qu’il déclarait infaillible en ce qui concerne l’action magnétique à exercer. Celle-ci s’adaptait rigoureusement aux exigences variables de chaque cas particulier.
last_phrase: In conclusion, Adolphe Didier possessed a remarkable sensitivity to the magnetic atmosphere of objects, allowing him to recognize magnetized books among others. His unique method of auscultation enabled him to diagnose illnesses based on anomalies in the vital radiations, adapt his treatments accordingly, and repair wisely the organism's losses. Didier's approach was not arbitrary nor violent, and his success was based on his ability to develop his discerning sensitivity.
